profile.name: Jon Snow
profile.currentTitle: Former King in the North & Lord Commander
profile.location: The True North, Beyond the Wall
profile.summary: Rose from bastard of Winterfell to King in the North through merit, not birthright. Youngest Lord Commander in Night's Watch history. United wildlings and Northerners against an existential threat when centuries of hatred said it was impossible. Led the defense of humanity at the Battle of Winterfell. Chose duty over ambition at every turn — the rarest leadership quality in Westeros.

skills.name: Crisis Leadership
evidence: Commanded the defense of Castle Black against a 100,000-strong wildling assault with fewer than 100 defenders
Led the coalition defense at the Battle of Winterfell against the Army of the Dead
Made the decision to execute Daenerys Targaryen to prevent further mass casualties — accepting personal consequences

skills.name: Coalition Building
evidence: United the Night's Watch and Free Folk — ending thousands of years of hostility — to face the White Walker threat
Convinced Northern lords to rally behind Stark banners after the Bolton occupation of Winterfell
Built alliance between the North and Daenerys Targaryen's forces despite deep cultural mistrust

skills.name: Military Tactics
evidence: Led tactical defense of Castle Black's southern gate against Thenn and wildling raiders
Commanded the Battle of the Bastards — adapted from near-defeat to victory through battlefield improvisation
Planned and executed the expedition beyond the Wall to capture a wight as proof of the existential threat

skills.name: Sword Combat
evidence: Defeated the White Walker at Hardhome in single combat using Valyrian steel
Survived the Battle of the Bastards through exceptional personal combat against overwhelming odds
Trained from childhood by Ser Rodrik Cassel and the master-at-arms of Winterfell

skills.name: Survival Skills
evidence: Survived extended operations beyond the Wall in extreme cold, hostile territory, and limited supplies
Infiltrated wildling society for intelligence gathering — maintaining cover for months
Survived literal death and resurrection — ultimate proof of resilience under pressure

skills.name: Strategic Decision-Making
evidence: Made the unpopular decision to allow wildlings through the Wall — prioritizing long-term survival over short-term politics
Chose to bend the knee to Daenerys to secure dragon support against the Night King — sacrificing title for mission
Decided to prioritize the existential threat of the White Walkers over the political game of thrones

skills.name: Inspirational Leadership
evidence: Inspired loyalty from the Night's Watch, wildlings, and Northern lords through personal courage and integrity
Led from the front in every battle — earning respect through shared risk rather than command from safety
Elected Lord Commander and later proclaimed King in the North by popular acclaim — not hereditary right

skills.name: Intelligence Operations
evidence: Conducted deep-cover intelligence operation within Mance Rayder's wildling army
Gathered critical intelligence on wildling military strength, tactics, and planned attack routes
Operated as double agent while maintaining ethical boundaries — refused to kill innocent civilians to maintain cover

skills.name: Negotiation
evidence: Negotiated alliance with Tormund Giantsbane and the Free Folk at Hardhome
Persuaded Daenerys Targaryen to commit her forces north against the White Walkers
Negotiated with Cersei Lannister at the Dragonpit — presenting evidence of the undead threat to hostile audience

skills.name: Personnel Development
evidence: Mentored Olly, Satin, and other young Night's Watch recruits
Developed leadership capabilities in Tormund, Edd Tollett, and other field commanders
Recognized talent in Samwell Tarly — sending him to the Citadel to train as maester despite resistance

skills.name: Ethical Leadership
evidence: Consistently chose the harder right over the easier wrong — including executing a child who betrayed him
Refused to claim the Iron Throne despite having the strongest hereditary claim as Aegon Targaryen
Accepted exile rather than pursue personal power after killing Daenerys

skills.name: Extreme Weather Operations
evidence: Conducted military operations in extreme arctic conditions beyond the Wall for extended periods
Led the expedition to capture a wight in blizzard conditions with a small team against undead forces
Survived exposure, combat injuries, and hypothermia during the frozen lake engagement north of the Wall

skills.name: Adaptive Strategy
evidence: Adapted Battle of the Bastards strategy in real-time when Rickon's death collapsed the original plan
Adjusted defensive positions at Winterfell as the Night King's forces broke through initial lines
Pivoted from conventional military thinking to unconventional coalition-building when facing supernatural threat

skills.name: Inter-Cultural Communication
evidence: Earned respect within wildling culture by understanding their values and meeting them as equals
Bridged the cultural divide between the disciplined Night's Watch and the freedom-loving Free Folk
Navigated the cultural expectations of Northern lords, Dothraki warriors, and Unsullied soldiers simultaneously

skills.name: Garrison Command
evidence: Commanded Castle Black as Lord Commander — managing personnel, supplies, and defenses
Organized the Night's Watch during a period of catastrophic losses and declining recruitment
Managed the integration of wildling refugees into Castle Black's operations and supply systems

skills.name: Reconnaissance
evidence: Conducted long-range reconnaissance missions beyond the Wall including the Fist of the First Men
Led the ranging to Hardhome that provided critical intelligence on White Walker capabilities
Scouted enemy positions and terrain during the Battle of the Bastards and the Battle of Winterfell

skills.name: Moral Courage
evidence: Stood alone against majority opinion to save the wildlings — and was murdered for it
Told Daenerys Targaryen the truth about his parentage despite knowing the political consequences
Killed the woman he loved to save millions — bearing the weight alone rather than seeking justification

purpose: To protect those who cannot protect themselves — regardless of what it costs, regardless of what others think, and regardless of what he stands to gain.

workHistory.title: Leader of the Free Folk
workHistory.company: The True North — Beyond the Wall
workHistory.description: Voluntarily exiled to the True North. Leads wildling communities in rebuilding beyond the Wall. Chose service over sovereignty.

workHistory.title: King in the North
workHistory.description: Proclaimed King by the Northern lords after liberating Winterfell. Built the Northern alliance that fought the Army of the Dead. Bent the knee to Daenerys to secure dragon support for the existential fight.

workHistory.title: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch
workHistory.description: Youngest Lord Commander in Night's Watch history. Made the controversial decision to allow wildlings through the Wall. Assassinated by his own men, resurrected, and continued command.

workHistory.title: Ranger & Intelligence Operative
workHistory.description: Night's Watch ranger conducting operations beyond the Wall. Infiltrated Mance Rayder's wildling army as deep-cover intelligence operative. Gathered critical military intelligence.

workHistory.title: Recruit & Steward
workHistory.description: Volunteered for the Night's Watch. Top recruit in combat training. Assigned as steward to Lord Commander Mormont — receiving mentorship in command and strategy.
